intro: Acronia chavezii, commonly known as the Chihuahua acronia, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. It is adapted to arid environments and has a compact, shrub-like growth form. Acronia chavezii is often found in rocky soils and is relatively rare in the wild.
